Content.p: Abstract: This dataset depicts all public access locations in Baldwin and Mobile counties
Purpose: These data were developed into a GIS in support of offshore sand research as funded through the Alabama Working Waterfront Coalition.
Currentness_Reference: current as of time period
Access_Constraints: For restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing this data set, contact the Geological Survey of Alabama (see Point_of_Contact).

Use_Constraints: Reproduction or redistribution of digital data sets or products derived therefrom to a third party organization or entity is expressly forbidden. None of these data shall be electronically duplicated on magnetic or optical media for use by others, in whole or in part, without permission of the Geological Survey of Alabama.

Any hardcopies utilizing these datasets shall clearly indicate their source. If the user has modified the data in any way, user is obligated to describe the types of modifications performed on the hardcopy map. User specifically agrees not to misrepresent these datasets, nor to imply that changes made were approved by the Geological Survey of Alabama (GSA).

The GSA should be acknowledged as the originator of the data. This dataset is to be used as a primary reference source. This is public information and may be interpreted by organizations, agencies, units of government, or others based on needs; however, they are responsible for the appropriate application. Federal, State, or local regulatory bodies are not to reassign to the originators any authority for the decisions they make.

Photographic or digital enlargement of these maps to scales greater than that at which they were originally delineated can cause misrepresentation of the data. If enlarged, the maps will not include the fine detail that would be appropriate for mapping at the large scale. Digital data files are periodically updated. Files are dated, and user is responsible for obtaining the latest version of the data.
Data_set_Credit: Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
Native_Data_Set_Environment: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497
All attributes were created by the source and assumed accurate as published.
Logical_Consistency_Report: The GSA did not further assess the point coverage.
Completeness_Report: This theme is believed to be complete as of June 05, 2014, and represented within coastal Alabama. Users should go to the source (see Data_Set_Credit) for an updated version.
Originator: Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
The GSA recieved an excel file from ADCNR
The GSA displayed the data as a shapefile in ArcGis 10.2.1 and projected the shapefile in WGS 84 Web Mercator Auxilary Sphere

The GSA created shapefiles based off attributes from the original file to display in flexviewer, the attributes displayed are boat lanes, picnic areas, fishing, swimming, nature trail, bike trail, campground, boat rental, playground, leashed pet, handicap parking, and boardwalks
Overview description was taken from the summary provided from the source (see_data_set_credit).
